title.content-text: 5.2.6 - Dividing the Networks - Networks from Networks

brief.content-text: The diagram depicts the structure of the hierarchical IPv4 address. In the example, the 32-bit IP address 192.168.18.57 is divided into two parts, a network portion and host portion. The first three octets (8 bits each) are the network portion, and the last octet (8 bits) is the host portion. In the example shown, 192.168.18 is the network portion, and dot 57 is the host portion of the IPv4 address.
